00023 void usage(const char *s) {
00024         cerr << "usage:\n" << s
00025                         << "[<cam number>|<video file>]  [-m <model image>]\n";
00026         exit(1);
00027 }

00029 int main( int argc, char** argv )
00030 {
00031         CvCapture* capture = 0;
00032 
00033         const char *captureSrc = "0";
00034 
00035         // parse command line
00036         for (int i=1; i<argc; i++) {
00037                 if (strcmp(argv[i], "-m") ==0) {
00038                         if (i==argc-1) usage(argv[0]);
00039                         modelFile = argv[i+1];
00040                         i++;
00041                 } else if (argv[i][0]=='-') {
00042                         usage(argv[0]);
00043                 } else {
00044                         captureSrc = argv[i];
00045                 }
00046         }
00047 
00048         if(strlen(captureSrc) == 1 && isdigit(captureSrc[0]))
00049                 capture = cvCaptureFromCAM( captureSrc[0]-'0');
00050         else 
00051                 capture = cvCaptureFromAVI( captureSrc ); 
00052 
00053         if( !capture )
00054         {
00055                 cerr <<"Could not initialize capturing from " << captureSrc << " ...\n";
00056                 return -1;
00057         }
00058 
00059         // Allocate the detector object
00060         planar_object_recognizer detector;
00061 
00062         // fine tuning for accuracy
00063         detector.ransac_dist_threshold = 5;
00064         detector.max_ransac_iterations = 800;
00065         detector.non_linear_refine_threshold = 2.5;
00066 
00067         // Train or load classifier
00068         if(!detector.build_with_cache(
00069                                 string(modelFile), // mode image file name
00070                                 400,               // maximum number of keypoints on the model
00071                                 32,                // patch size in pixels
00072                                 3,                 // yape radius. Use 3,5 or 7.
00073                                 16,                // number of trees for the classifier. Somewhere between 12-50
00074                                 1                  // number of levels in the gaussian pyramid
00075                                 ))
00076         {
00077                 cerr << "Unable to load the model image "
00078                        << modelFile <<" or its classifier.\n";
00079                 return -1;
00080         }
00081 
00082         // A lower threshold will allow detection in harder conditions, but
00083         // might lead to false positives.
00084         detector.match_score_threshold=.03f;
00085 
00086         const char *win = "Bazar";
00087 
00088         IplImage* display=0;
00089         IplImage*gray=0;
00090 
00091         cvNamedWindow(win, 0);
00092 
00093         CamAugmentation augment;
00094 
00095         if (!augment.LoadOptimalStructureFromFile("camera_c.txt", "camera_r_t.txt")) {
00096                 cerr << "Unable to load calibration data\n";
00097                 return -2;
00098         }
00099 
00100         for(;;)
00101         {
00102                 // acquire image
00103                 IplImage *frame = cvQueryFrame( capture );
00104                 if( !frame )
00105                         break;
00106 
00107                 // convert it to gray levels, if required
00108                 if (frame->nChannels >1) {
00109                         if( !gray ) 
00110                                 gray = cvCreateImage( cvGetSize(frame), IPL_DEPTH_8U, 1 );
00111                         cvCvtColor(frame, gray, CV_RGB2GRAY);
00112                 } else {
00113                         gray = frame;
00114                 }
00115 
00116                 // run the detector
00117                 if (detector.detect(gray)) {
00118                         // start on a new frame
00119                         augment.Clear();
00120 
00121                         // we have only 1 camera
00122                         add_detected_homography(detector, augment);
00123 
00124                         // bundle adjust
00125                         augment.Accomodate(4, 1e-4);
00126                         show_result(augment, frame, &display);
00127                         cvShowImage(win,display);
00128                 } else {
00129                         cvShowImage(win, frame);
00130                 }
00131                 //cvShowImage(win, frame);
00132 
00133                 if( cvWaitKey(10) >= 0 )
00134                         break;
00135         }
00136 
00137         cvReleaseCapture( &capture );
00138         cvDestroyWindow(win);
00139 
00140         return 0;
00141 }
00142 
00143 void show_result(CamAugmentation &augment, IplImage *video, IplImage **dst)
00144 {
00145         if (*dst==0) *dst=cvCloneImage(video);
00146         else cvCopy(video, *dst);
00147 
00148         CvMat *m = augment.GetProjectionMatrix(0);
00149         if (!m) return;
00150 
00151         double w =video->width/2.0;
00152         double h =video->height/2.0;
00153 
00154         // 3D coordinates of an object
00155         double pts[4][4] = {
00156                 {w,h,0, 1},
00157                 {2*w,h,0, 1},
00158                 {w,2*h,0, 1},
00159                 {w,h,-w-h, 1}
00160         };
00161         double projected[3][4];
00162         CvMat ptsMat, projectedMat;
00163         cvInitMatHeader(&ptsMat, 4, 4, CV_64FC1, pts);
00164         cvInitMatHeader(&projectedMat, 3, 4, CV_64FC1, projected);
00165 
00166         // project the 4 3D points
00167         cvGEMM(m, &ptsMat, 1, 0, 0, &projectedMat, CV_GEMM_B_T );
00168         for (int i=0; i<4; i++) {
00169                 projected[0][i] /= projected[2][i];
00170                 projected[1][i] /= projected[2][i];
00171         }
00172 
00173         // draw the projected lines
00174         cvLine(*dst, cvPoint((int)projected[0][0], (int)projected[1][0]),
00175                         cvPoint((int)projected[0][1], (int)projected[1][1]), CV_RGB(0,255,0));
00176         cvLine(*dst, cvPoint((int)projected[0][0], (int)projected[1][0]),
00177                         cvPoint((int)projected[0][2], (int)projected[1][2]), CV_RGB(255,0,0));
00178         cvLine(*dst, cvPoint((int)projected[0][0], (int)projected[1][0]),
00179                         cvPoint((int)projected[0][3], (int)projected[1][3]), CV_RGB(0,0,255));
00180 
00181         
00182         cvReleaseMat(&m);
00183 }
00184 
00185 bool add_detected_homography(planar_object_recognizer &detector, CamAugmentation &a)
00186 {
00187         static std::vector<CamCalibration::s_struct_points> pts;
00188         pts.clear();
00189 
00190         for (int i=0; i<detector.match_number; ++i) {
00191                         image_object_point_match * match = detector.matches+i;
00192                         if (match->inlier) {
00193                                 pts.push_back(CamCalibration::s_struct_points(
00194                                         PyrImage::convCoordf(match->image_point->u, int(match->image_point->scale), 0),
00195                                         PyrImage::convCoordf(match->image_point->v, int(match->image_point->scale), 0),
00196                                         PyrImage::convCoordf(match->object_point->M[0], int(match->object_point->scale), 0),
00197                                         PyrImage::convCoordf(match->object_point->M[1], int(match->object_point->scale), 0)));
00198                         }
00199         }
00200 
00201         a.AddHomography(pts, detector.H);
00202         return true;
00203 }
